title: APRA needs 10-20pc budget boost: Byres
text:
The Australian Prudential Regulatory Authority requires an additional budget allocation of up to 20 per cent in order to implement the recommendations of the Samuel review, says chairman Wayne Byres.

The government-ordered APRA Capability Review handed down its finding of major "internal culture" problems at the prudential regulator in July, making 24 recommendations for reform.

APRA will need 10-20 per cent more funding to implement the Samuel review recommendations, says chair Wayne Byres. Louie Douvis

Mr Byres told a Senate Estimates hearing on Wednesday that APRA will need greater resources in order to raise standards and address the criticisms levelled against it by the review's authors, Graeme Samuel, Diane Smith-Gander and Grant Spencer following their four month probe.

“The capability review set us a very ambitious agenda, we accepted the recommendations and are happy to embrace them," Mr Byres said.

"But it will require us to talk to the government about resourcing, which we are doing. If we wish to fulfil all of the recommendations ... then it will require additional resourcing."
description: APRA chairman Wayne Byres has complained about under-resourcing for some time. Now he's put a number on it.
